name: Titanium.UI.iOS.SplitWindow
summary: A SplitWindow is a window that manages the presentation of two side-by-side view controllers.

parameters.name: masterIsOverlayed
parameters.summary: Determines whether to show the master view is overlayed in portrait orientation.

parameters.name: options
parameters.summary:
Determines whether the scrollable region reposition should be animated. On iOS, use the optional property animated to animate changes to masterView display mode in portrait orientation. For example

setMasterIsOverlayed(true, { animated: true });

Note that the default here is equivalent to passing in { animated: false }

parameters.name: showMasterInPortrait
parameters.summary: Determines whether to show the master view in portrait orientation.

parameters.name: options
parameters.summary:
Determines whether the scrollable region reposition should be animated. On iOS, use the optional property animated to animate changes to masterView display mode in portrait orientation. For example

setShowMasterInPortrait(true, { animated: true });

Note that the default here is equivalent to passing in { animated: false }

properties.name: detailView
properties.summary: Window for the detail view section of the SplitWindow.

properties.name: landscapeSplit
properties.summary: Determines the width of the masterView in landscape mode.
properties.description: These values are capped in the range 0.25 to 0.5. Any values outside this range are ignored.
properties.default: The width of the master-view divided by the screen-height

properties.name: masterIsOverlayed
properties.summary: Determines whether to show the master view is overlayed in portrait orientation.
properties.description: Note that you need to set showMasterInPortrait to true if you want to use this property in portrait mode.

properties.name: masterView
properties.summary: Window for the master view section of the SplitWindow.

properties.name: masterViewVisible
properties.summary: Determines whether to show the master view or hide.

properties.name: portraitSplit
properties.summary: Determines the width of the masterView in portrait mode.
properties.description: These values are capped in the range 0.25 to 0.5. Any values outside this range are ignored.
properties.default: The width of the master-view divided by the screen-width

properties.name: showMasterInPortrait
properties.summary: Determines whether to show the master view in portrait orientation.
